logic
Class GameState

java.lang.Object
  logic.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class handles all the logic from the game and uses all the other logic classes.

Author:
PedroBarbosa
See Also:

public boolean getState()
Returns the state of this gamestate.

true - active
false - finished

state

initialize

public void initialize()
Initializes the gamestate with a 10x10 pre-defined board.

initialize

public void initialize(int size)
Initializes the gamestate with a user defined board. Size must be an odd number.

Parameters:
size - size of the game board

getDifficulty

public int getDifficulty()

setDifficulty

public void setDifficulty(int dif)
Sets the difficulty of the game.

1 - immovable dragons
2 - roamming dragons
3 - roamming dragons + asleep

Parameters:
dif - difficulty of the game

addElements

public void addElements()
Adds elements to the gamestate.

play

public boolean play(java.lang.String s)
Initiates a play.

This function executes the command of the hero( move or fire ).
Moves the dragons and checks collision with the hero and the dragons.
Checks if hero is dead or has won the game.
Prints the game in the console.

Parameters:
s - command of the hero
Returns:
state

moveHero

public void moveHero(char dir)
Moves hero in one of the four possible directions.

direction:

'w' | 'W' - North
's' | 'S' - South
'd' | 'D' - East
'a' | 'A' - West

Parameters:
dir - direction

shootDard

public void shootDard()
Shoots a dard in all four directions.
The first dragon in each direction in
reach dies and is removed from play.

checkCollisionWithDragon

public int checkCollisionWithDragon()
Checks if the hero is adjacent to one or more dragons.
If the hero is equipped with a sword the dragon
dies. If the hero doesn't have a sword equipped
the hero dies and the game ends.

Returns:
1 - if hero dies
2 - if hero kills dragons

removeElement

public void removeElement(java.lang.String tipo,
                          int x,
                          int y)
Removes a certain element from the elements list.

Parameters:
tipo - type of element
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate

moveDragons

public void moveDragons()
Moves all dragons in the dragons list.
For each dragon it calls the function moveDragao(Dragao d).

validMovementDragon

public int validMovementDragon(int dir,
                               Dragon d)
Checks and evaluates the movement of the dragon.

Parameters:
dir - direction of the movement
d - dragon to move
Returns:
0 - valid movement
1 - invalid movement because of wall
2 - invalid movement because of other dragon

moveDragao

public void moveDragao(Dragon d)
Moves a dragon in a random valid direction

Parameters:
d - dragon to move

killAdjacentDragons

public void killAdjacentDragons(char norte,
                                char sul,
                                char este,
                                char oeste)
Kills all adjacent dragons in all directions.

Parameters:
norte - north position
sul - south position
este - east position
oeste - west position

checkFinal

public boolean checkFinal()
Checks if hero is in the exit.

Returns:
true - if hero is in exit
false - if hero is not in the exit

checkDragonRange

public boolean checkDragonRange()
Checks if hero is in a dragon's range.

Returns:
true - if hero is in range
false - if hero isn't in range

moveDragaoDirection

public void moveDragaoDirection(Dragon d,
                                char nextChar,
                                int nextX,
                                int nextY,
                                int initialX,
                                int initialY)
Moves a dragon in one of the four valid directions
and sets it's position and symbol.

Parameters:
d - dragon
nextChar - next position
nextX - next x coordinate
nextY - next y coordinate
initialX - initial x coordinate
initialY - initial y coordinate

restartGame

public void restartGame()
This function restars the game. Creates a new
maze and new element positions.
